channel.title: WTF accounts keep getting hacked!
channel.description: 2 of my accounts were hacked last week so i changed the password and kept on playing, trying to get money and supplies back.... then, not even 10 minutes ago i tried to log on and it said i was already logged on...... so i got on my newb account to see if somebody was really on my account.... i tried talking to the person and after a while they responded saying they wanted rs items or they'll pc crash me...... they know all of my usernames and passwords!!!! i got back on my account that was being hacked and everything was gone, once again, and then i tried logging back into the newb account to see if anything was happening to that one and...... it was!!! that account was hacked and now, my other account has been hacked!!! is it possible that someone is using a keylogger against me? if so, how would i check? iv given my computer many virus scans with pandacloud and nothing has turned up!!! Somebody please help me!!

item.title: WTF accounts keep getting hacked!
item.dc:creator: @zero380 zero380
item.description:
@zero380 wrote:

ok i scanned with the malware thing and it came up with like 15 trojans and like 175-180 adware shit… thats a good scanner i didnt see anything about a RAT… could somebody give me a “crash course” on common viruses and how to get rid of them, what they do, ect… im not so smart when it comes to that stuff

Read full topic

item.title: WTF accounts keep getting hacked!
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[size=36pt]BBQ1111111[/size]
well… just turn off your computer, go log on from another computer, then say “idgaf, crash ma pc bitch” and just troll him all nite long like that.

Read full topic

item.title: WTF accounts keep getting hacked!
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Remote_administration_tool

Basically they can do anything they want on your PC. Access all of your files, keylog you, use your computer to perform a DoS attack, etc.

I know that AVG detected a DarkComet RAT someone tried to plant in my PC. As said by CoonHunter and Tom_BETA you need to perform a full and thorough virus scan. You should probably not log into anything else until you have done this.

Read full topic

item.title: WTF accounts keep getting hacked!
item.dc:creator: @zero380 zero380
item.description:
@zero380 wrote:

ya they said something about a RAT… what does that mean… could somebody explain to me what a RAT is?

Read full topic

item.title: WTF accounts keep getting hacked!
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

If they threatened to crash your PC, they’ve probably installed a RAT on your system. I suggest you run a scan immediately (Malwarebytes etc). Also, try and remember what might of infected you. If the RAT is FUD (fully undetectable) you’ll need to take more measures to remove it.

It’s most likely that the virus launches on startup also, check your startup folder for any suspicious files (e.g winlog.exe, system32.exe, svchost.exe are common names). Check common directories like the below.

C:\Windows
C:\Windows\system32
C:\Windows\system
C:\

Those are all common virus installation directories. If you’ve had no luck download a good scanner e.g malwarebytes, norton etc.

Download.com

Malwarebytes

Malwarebytes 3.0 was a major update when it arrived in December 2016 -- and like many major updates, some aspects were a little rough, particularly stability

eset.com

ESET NOD32 Antivirus

Record-breaking antivirus and antispyware protection. Enjoy advanced technology that does not slow your PC. Download the latest ESET NOD32 ANTIVIRUS now! 30 Day Free Trial

Are some good, free examples. Ensure they’ve been updated then boot into safe mode and scan with them, safe mode will disable the virus making it impossible for him to stop you while you’re scanning. If all fails and it is FUD, you can monitor connections from specific processes in order to gain an insight into where it is, and how to remove it.

You can also take a look at your system processes (ctrl alt del), if you notice anything unusual, go to properties, get the location then end the process and remove it (Only if you’re sure though)

Once you’ve removed it, install a good firewall and do regular system scans, and be careful what you click on! Your virus scanner doesn’t sound very good. One vital thing you have to look out for is the disabling of UAC, this allows the person to perform admin tasks without your consent, if this has been disabled re-enable it now! I’d also suggest you wipe your private data from all browsers so the person can’t grab the data from the browser file. In most cases it’s just

Menu > settings > delete private data

and that’s it. If you’re really struggling either find a white hat forum, or PM me. Or restore your system to a saved restore point (Which is basing on the fact he hasn’t spread the file)

Read full topic
